page.title: 01EDUCATION INTRODUCTION
page.content: This area of land has been little used apart from farming and fruit orchards for centuries,although pilgrims have visited Canterbury since the time of Becket. However,the compulsory Education Acts of the nineteenth century have produced a different type of pilgrimage. Daily, six thousand pupils journey to seven educational establishments,existing within three square kilometres.There is a great diversity in both subject matter and age,and to emphasise these differences some information from parent and pupil interviews has been set out in note form,followed by short passages by pupils at the schools and their pupil visitors. Research at the University about Halley's Comet begins our survey.
